review: I like the overall idea and ease of use is moderately friendly.  Disappointing to see some of the heavy pricing on many of the respectable titles of interest.  Seems to fall short on Prime member content.  Can't even get "The Simpson's" episodes with being a Prime member!  I believe it is $2.99 an episode last I checked...which is a little steep for something that has been on free TV for so many years!  Overall content available seems adequate enough...but certainly comes at a premium price (on top of Prime membership as it is).
author: John P.

review: This thing is literally a Magic Box! I was surfing craigslist one day and heard about this as a cable alternative, when it's side-loaded with certain programs. Figured I would give it a try. First off, Amazon Primes streaming service works better then Netflix or Hulu. That may seem like a suck up exaggeration to Amazon, but it's entirely true. The load time for videos on Prime is easily twice as fast, and the content is more pertinent to me. The ability to modify this device is unparalleled and Amazon provides the necessary application files/guides in order to tweak the box to your liking. The ability to play games off of it, most of them free to play, is another plus. The minimalist design of the remote is a long ways off of the average TV remote which almost needs a map to read. Most importantly all the applications I side-loaded onto it did indeed replace my cable, I bought 3 of these to cover my house and have bought one for all my friends and family.
